article.title: The CARMENES search for exoplanets around M dwarfs. First visual-channel radial-velocity measurements and orbital parameter updates of seven M-dwarf planetary systems

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main purpose of showing these periodograms?
choices: To identify the known planet periods.
To estimate the stellar rotation periods.
To assess the impact of stellar activity.
To compare the Hα index with other activity indicators.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded from the GLS periodogram of the residuals after fitting the 8.77 d signal (panel c)?
choices: The 8.77 d signal is likely due to stellar activity.
There is evidence for a second planetary companion.
The 39.34 d signal is likely due to stellar activity.
The Keplerian fit is not a good model for GJ 176 b.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main evidence supporting the existence of the second planet GJ 1148 c?
choices: The strong Hα signal at 530 days.
The significant GLS peaks in the residuals after fitting GJ 1148 b.
The large overall scatter of the one-planet fit.
The linear trend seen in the combined RV data.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the minimum mass (in Earth masses) and orbital period (in days) of the planet GJ 536 b?
